# ================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-START ==================
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class ModelNew(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, input_size, hidden_size, num_layers=3, bias=True, batch_first=False):
        super(ModelNew, self).__init__()
        self.num_layers = num_layers
        self.hidden_size = hidden_size
        
        self.gru = nn.GRU(input_size, hidden_size, num_layers, bias, batch_first, dropout=0, bidirectional=True)
        # Convert GRU to half precision for Tensor Core acceleration
        self.gru = self.gru.half()
        # Initialize placeholder for hidden state (will be recreated in forward)
        self.register_buffer('h0', torch.zeros(num_layers * 2, 1, hidden_size))

    def forward(self, x):
        # Reinitialize hidden state with correct batch size and device in half precision
        if self.h0.shape[1] != x.size(1):
            h0 = torch.zeros(self.num_layers * 2, x.size(1), self.hidden_size, 
                             device=x.device, dtype=torch.half)
        else:
            h0 = self.h0.to(device=x.device, dtype=torch.half)
        
        # Convert input to half precision and run GRU
        x_half = x.half()
        _, h_n = self.gru(x_half, h0)
        # Convert final hidden state back to float32 for numerical stability
        return h_n.float()

# Test code
batch_size = 10
seq_len = 512
input_size = 128
hidden_size = 256
num_layers = 6

def get_inputs():
    return [torch.randn(seq_len, batch_size, input_size)]

def get_init_inputs():
    return [input_size, hidden_size, num_layers]
# =================== EVOLVE-BLOCK-END ===================
